document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Li, Tong & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part IV: the ornata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (II)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part IV: the ornata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (II)

bibRefCitation.author: Okada
bibRefCitation.refString: Okada, H. (1968) Addition to the fauna of the family Drosophilidae of Japan and adjacent countries (Diptera: Drosophilidae). Kontyu, Tokyo, 36, 303 - 323.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Aedeagus curved subbasally and subapically, with pubescence distally, acute apically (
Fig. 18
D).

Description. Ocellar triangle yellowish brown, with 4–8 setae above ocellar setae. Frons yellowish brown to brown. Pedicel mostly yellowish brown; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus brownish medially, dark brown laterally. Palpus brownish yellow. Mesonotum brownish yellow to yellowish brown, with brown, longitudinal stripes laterally (
Fig. 5
A, B), sometimes dark brown medially (
Fig. 5
A). Postpronotal lobe yellow (
Fig. 5
C, D). Acrostichal setulae in 10–12 irregular rows (
Fig. 5
A, B). Scutellum brownish yellow to yellowish brown, dark brown laterally, yellow at tip (
Fig. 5
A, B). Pleura with a brown, longitudinal stripe above (
Fig. 5
C, D). Katepisternum and mesopleuron (meron in
Huang et al . 2013 a
, b ) mostly brownish yellow; mesopleuron with a brownish patch (
Fig. 5
C, D). Wing (
Fig. 2
A): Costal vein between R 2 + 3 and R 4 + 5 distally with 5–8 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Abdominal tergites black, with yellow patches (
Fig. 10
A). Male terminalia: Epandrium nearly entirely pubescent, with 17 setae near posterior margin and ventral corner per side (
Fig. 18
A). Hypandrium with long pubescence anteriorly (
Fig. 18
B). Paramere with 6 sensilla submediodorsally (
Fig. 18
C).
